intro: Aulomyrcia cambessedesiana, commonly known as the Cauca wax tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stem, palmate leaves, and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
